```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(lmtest)
install.packages("car")

library(car)

# Load and prepare the dataset
df <- read.csv("tesla_updated.csv")  # Adjust the filename as necessary

# Convert date column to Date format if not already
df$date <- as.Date(df$date)

# Handling missing values - omit rows with any NA values
df <- na.omit(df)

# Inspect the structure of the dataframe to confirm it's ready for analysis
str(df)

# Define the linear regression model
model <- lm(change_percent ~ volume + open + high + low + close, data = df)

# Display the summary of the model to examine coefficients and statistical significance
summary(model)

# Plotting diagnostic plots for model evaluation
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
plot(model)

# Checking for multicollinearity using Variance Inflation Factor
vif_results <- vif(model)
print(vif_results)


# A VIF > 5 indicates high multicollinearity.

```
